Post-Match Reflections: Trail Blazers head coach Chauncey Billups summed this game against the Spurs up by saying that he felt his team was 'chasing our tails' for the entire game.
Billups spoke about Shaedon Sharpe's return after the fact.

Billups said of Victor Wembanyama, 'I thought we did a good job on him. I really did. We switched up who was guarding him. We did a few things...He's the kind of player that even if you do a good job on him, he'll try to make the proper pass. He's not gonna over shoot because you did a good job on him'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Portland Trail Blazers dropped another game on Thursday night, losing to the San Antonio Spurs by a score of 118-105.
Portland shot nine-of-32 from beyond the 3-point line for a 28 percent clip.
In contrast, San Antonio shot 16-of-29 from 3-point range.
Shaedon Sharpe returned to the court for this contest but his presence wasn't enough to help them earn a win.
He shot six-of-nine from the field, scoring 13 points with two rebounds and one assist.
The Trail Blazers held the Spurs star Victor Wembanyama to 12 points, eight rebounds, four steals, and three blocks.
Portland drops to 3-6 on the new season.
Others: The Trail Blazers haven't played very well but they have shown more competitiveness in most of their games.
The Trail Blazers never really seemed to be in control of their own gameplan.
The Frost Bank Center was the location of the game.
